page.title: 01Introduction
page.content: Littlebourne area includes the villages of Ickham Littlebourne, Wickhambreux thus comprising 3 communities each separate with its own Parish Council, Church,Village Hall. Littlebourne has its own vicar whilst Wickhambreux + Ickham share one with Stodmarsh. Shortly all four will join. Ickham has no school. A unifying element is the Little Stour River which rises in the chalk and runs through all three parishes often forming the boundary between. It is also fed by the Nailbourne an intermittent stream. Bramling and Wingham Well are small hamlets looking to Ickham + Wingham as their centres. The whole area is mixed agricultural land of high quality growing a whole diversity of crops. There are water meadows by the river, patches of woodland + many well used footpaths.
